pageProduct.name: Otrivin Metered Dose Nasal Mist Junior 10mL
pageProduct.description:
Information

General Information

Otrivin Nasal Spray Junior clears blocked noses.

Otrivin Junior Nasal Spray is a nasal decongestant formulated with a lower concentration of active ingredient to provide little blocked noses short-term relief of a blocked or runny nose caused by colds, flu, sinusitis, hayfever or other allergic rhinitis. Perfect for children who favour a spray format.

Otrivin Junior Nasal Spray can be used by Children 6-11 years, on the advice of a doctor or pharmacist for the temporary relief of nasal congestion due to colds, hay fever or other allergic rhinitis and sinusitis.

Nasal decongestant. Acts quickly to relieve a blocked or runny nose caused by colds, flu, sinusitis, hayfever or other allergic rhinitis. Short-term treatment of allergic rhinitis to relieve severe nasal congestion.

Size: 10mL

Warnings

- Brief stinging sensation or sneezing may occur.
- Excessive use may damage lining of nose.
- If irritation occurs or you have signs of allergy, discontinue use.

CAUTION

Keep out of reach of children.
- If congestion persists for more than 3 days, seek medical advice.
- Each pack should be used by only one person, for reasons of hygiene.
- Do not use in or around eyes.

Ingredients

Xylometazoline Hydrochloride 0.5 mg/mL.

Contains: Benzalkonium Chloride as a Preservative

Directions

- Before first use, remove protective cap and press applicator until an even spray is produced.
- Clear nose of mucus by wiping, or have child blow gently.
- Insert nozzle into the nostril and press applicator firmly once. Children old enough to understand should be told to sniff during application.
- Withdraw nozzle and release applicator. Repeat in other nostril.
- Wipe nozzle and replace cap.

USAGE ADVICE

Use Otrivin for:
Fast, temporary, relief of a blocked or runny nose caused by colds, flu, sinusitis, hay fever or other allergic rhinitis.

Who can use Otrivin Junior:
Children aged 6-11 years only on the advice of a doctor or pharmacist.

Dosage
- Children aged 6-11 years: 2 sprays per nostril.
- Use 2-3 times daily, as necessary.
- Do not use more often than every 8-10 hours.
- Do not exceed the recommended dosage.

SAFETY DIRECTIONS

Do not use:
- In children under 6 years of age.
- If allergic to Xylometazoline.
- After recent operations through the nose or mouth.
- If you have narrow angle glaucoma.
- If you have inflammatory nasal dryness.

Ask your doctor before use:
- If you are pregnant or breast feeding or trying to become pregnant.
- If you have any other medical conditions.
- If you are taking other medicines.

STORAGE INSTRUCTIONS

Store below 30°C.

Storage Temperature: Below 30°C.
